text: Za drogi ten malinowy chruśniak, liczyłem na sztosa, a wypiłem ledwie przyzwoitego kwasa. Belgijskie oryginały tańsze i lepsze, nie wspominając dwa razy tańszego browna Chateau Artezan, który niszczy konkurencję.

375 ml bottle at home. Hazy dark copper reddish brown color with beige head. Malty and yeasty aroma, tart fruity, raspberries, cherries, wood, vinous, light funky. Heavy acidic taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation

Bottle from 2010... Poured red with a pink-ish head. Nice, tart and prominent raspberry notes on the nose. Some sourness, and dryness from attenuation. But overall a lovely raspberry flavor and sweetness with some tartness to follow. Help up strong over all these years.

Bottle. Murky brown, beige head. Up close its got soir funk and raspberry jam on the nose, from a distance I can smell raspberries, its quite nice. Very very tart, builds up slowly, more puckeringly tart than funky sour. Not much vinegar, just tart raspberry and an earthy woody palate like a sweeter red wine. Massively tart, I love how each sip kind of explodes and gets more and more intense. Pretty kickass.
On tap. Murky red brownish color with beige head. Intense raspberry jam and pits, light toasted malt and a bit of acidic balsamic vinegar. Medium plus body, high carbonation.

Possibly the true sourest beer Ive drank. Aroma doesnt truly do it justice, with some oak and raspberry. Looks like carbonated mud water. Flavour is extreme raspberry and sourness, lots of funk and some minor oak to finish. Overall a fantastic beer and very unique.

On tap at Himmeriget. Pours a clear darkish brown. Mellow tartness with a medium dryness. Juicy aromas of sour raspberries. Lots of cask wood. Hints of børnevitaminer. Medium bodied. Medium to lively carbonation. Dry finish with more sour fruits and cask wood.
Draft at Himmeriget. Pours a murky red with an off-white head. Shitloads of raspberry, milky yoghurty goodness, like an acidic milkshake, freshly juiced. Zesty fruit with a lovely depth to it.

On tap at Himmerigget. Murky muddy red with a thin beige head. Tons of raspberries in the taste notes, smoothly integrated with the wine barrel. Acidic, with wine vinegar, sour cherries, light vanilla. Near perfect.

Bottle from Saveur Biere. Dark, dirty red beer with small and vanishing head. Strong aroma has lots of strawberries, vinegar and barrel. Taste has also lots of strawberries and vinegar together with lots of sourness at the end. Medium body. Nice overall, even if im not a big fan of these sour beers.

375ml bottle shared @Pułapka, Gdańsk

Vinegar, fruit pits, notes of red fruit. Earthy sour fruity taste, some slight pit bitterness. Very intense and tasty. Medium high C02

Heavy smell and taste of the luscious raspberries. Sour aftertaste which fills the front of the mouth for a long time. Delicious beer with a lot of taste. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
Bottle in Encinitas w/ Bri. Lots of barrel character and sweet raspberries, some dark fruit (black currant) and Brett as well. Exceptional sour. Together with Cuvée de Tomme my favorite LA beer.

375ml bottle. Dark ruby colour with small, frothy, fading, pink-ish head. Full-blown raspberry aroma encompassing the complete range of sweet-ish, tart, fruity and earthy, leafy aspects. Taste is tart to sour, initially raspberry-dominated, fruity, later more vinous, dry and spicy, notes of red wine, blue grapes juice, hints of black pepper. Gentle carbonation.

W zapachu maliny, stajnia, dzikie drożdże, kwasowość. Smak - dużo octowej kwaśności, pestki malin, beczkowa wytrawność, taniny. Sporo goryczy, nie ma w ogóle słodkich nut. Wysycenie średnie. Bardzo złożone piwo, dobrze ułożone, lekko rozgrzewa.
Rasberry vinegar in the aroma. Very sour but rich in fruits. Carbonation right on the spot. Grear beer (I am not a sour / wild lover).
Aroma of sweet raspberry, funky in the background. Taste kicks ass, very sour, stable, wild. Awesome
Hazy brown body with a medium white head. Aroma is fresh berries, caramel, straw. Taste is tart and light sweet. Fruity and sour finish. Medium body, soft carbonation.

From notes. Enjoyed at a bottle share at Seans on December 29. 375 mL bottle. The pour is a nice reddish-brown color with a thicker off white colored head and a spot or two of lace as it falls. The aroma is really good. Heavy raspberry right up front. There is a nice tart sourness and a lingering barrel character that really adds some depth. There is a maltiness that comes through on the finish with a light bit of funk joining it. The flavor is a little more complex. There are layers of fruit, funk, malt, earth, barrel, and a light yeastiness. Its really solid. The mouth feel is light and crisp with a bright carbonation and a lingeringly sour raspberry with a hint of barrel on the finish. I love this beer.

Draft Third of a Pint at Route CBC Festival at Craft Beer Co, Clapham, London in Oct 2015 - Barrel-Aged Raspberry Sour. Sour Brown with raspberries. Amber Red in colour. Very Fruity; tart raspberries. Sour, tart, acidic, funky, quite earthy, woody and very dry. Very good mouth puckering raspberry sour ale! (2015-10-02)

Een diep rood-rozige kleur met witte schuimkraag.
In de geur de zoete en tegelijk zurige aspecten van framboosjes. Spijtig komt er ook het melkzuurtje terug in de geur. De smaak is verfrissend zuur aangevuld met framboosjes.
Bottle from the importer. how the fruits can work as well with malts and sour...

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Rami Rami is drinking a Framboise de Amorosa by The Lost Abbey at Powiśle2015. Mega owocki, i to nie to, ze tylko maliny, ale tez pestki z wisni i insze takie. Mocno kwasne, ciut octowe (moze wiecej niz ciut), ciut taninowe, (...)Rami Rami: Owocowa slodycz, mocno winne, super zrownowazone i najzwyczajniej bardzo smaczneOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Leje: sie malinowe w szkle ciemno malinowe, czerwone wino? 
zapach: ooo no jest bardzo dobrze, maliny świeże słodkie ociekające sokiem, może nawet cukierki słodkie, akcenty dzikie w postaci skóry i nuty dębowe 
smak maliny uderzenie kwasu chyba najbardziej kwaśne piwo jakie dotknęło moich ust więc jest dobrze dla mnie, wytrawne ale maliny dają wrażenie słodyczy mimo kompletnego braku. Czuć też beczkę, taniny, skórę. Finish malinowy gdzie pałętają sie aromaty tanin, końskiej derki. 
Kwas jest bardzo intensywny ale nadaje pięknego charakteru i drapie w przełyk mocno. :D 
Wysycenie wysokie goryczka niska ale taninowy z beczki fajnie robią robotę.
Bottleshare at Brewdog Bar. reddish colour, beige head. Lots of raspberry in aroma, complex raspberry, a bit of cherry. Tart and sour, got a real dryness that sneaks in from underneath. Good.

UPDATED: DEC 8, 2016 Bottle at home. Beautiful reddish chestnut colour, stable beige creamy head. Incredibly rich, sweet and fruity raspberry nose. Taste has these rich raspberry notes too, a bit vinous but lacks real barrel character, but nicely accompanied by sweet malts. High acidity, tard, Rodenbach Caractere-ish. Aftertaste lingers nice and fruity. Good body, lively carbonation.

Aroma:

Medium/heavy aroma of malts, caramel, wood, raspberry and tart.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque dark orange/brown beer with slight yeast and with a slight/medium off-white/beige head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, caramel, wood and raspberry; ends slightly dry and sour with tart.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. Tastes almost exactly like a fresh raspberry. Extremely satisfying with a great balance between sweet and sour. The head disappears too fast however and sadly does not come back.

Sample at GABF 10/08/2016, thanks to my sis for assistance with note-taking.Hazy ruby-amber color with a medium off-white head that recedes steadily. Stringy lacing. Tart berries, yeast and malt in the nose. Medium body with flavors of tart raspberry, herbal yeast and doughy malt. The finish is moderately sour with a red wine and raspberry aftertaste. Good beer all around.

Pours dark ruby, almost brown with small head. Aroma: a nick kick of fresh raspberries, coupled with aroma of fresh cream. Taste: again a lot of raspberries, sweet, but immediately countered by pretty intense and nice sourness, with an extreme long sour palate. Some wood from the barrel present. Great.
2016-10-07 Sample from bottle @ Stockholm Beer & Whisky Festival. Aroma of vinegar. Medium tartness. Taste of vinegar and hints of raspberries.

Sample from bottle from web order, poured slight cloudy light Amber deep red with a light off head. Nose of tart raspberries, light caramel, vinegar tartness, raspberry pie, leather, light yeast, sweet caramel.
Duft hindbær sødme lidt jordbær sur en kant syrlig tør duft, smag sur citrus hindbær tør lidt jordbær rød kant
Bottle share. Deep hazy pink/light amber. Light pink head. Huge tart fresh raspberry aroma and flavors. Rich, deep and jammy. Even better than the Firestone Bretta Rose. Simply terrific.

daeep dark amber to brown colour, half inch peach colour-like dense head; aroma of raspberry, woody-tannin-like notes, some barnyard and tart; taste is the same with balsamic vinegar; the sourish-tannin-like bittery notes dominte over the raspbery, but its also there in the background; excellent!

Bottle from last nights share. A nice dark amber body, small ring of head. Big berry aroma, lots of sourness, barrel essences, and the yeast. All blends perfectly in the taste, sour without too much pucker, and sweet at the same time. Excellent example of the style.

A: Cloudy deep red/purple/brownish coloured with a thin pink lacing. N: Raspberry, vinegar, caramel T: Raspberry, raspberry seeds, caramel, hint of liqourice O: Wow! Very nice balanced tartness and raspberry! Lovely!
Exactly what is says. High ripe REAL fresh raspberry scent. Not too sour of a scent. Sour taste hits, raspberry taste is great. Not too heavy, just a nice Balance with the sour. Brown red hazy. Tap
2010 bottle thanks to Rick. Pours a muddy brown with small frothy white head that lasts. The aroma is strong oak, funk, cherry skin. Thin, very sour, cherry, oak tannin, very acidic, good.

This brewery has had its najor ups and downs, flat garbage years back, and lots of silence, but this. Is. Gold .. . Rich berry, tartness, candy, fruit cities, and summer fruit .. Solid mouth, all good and happy, wish i had more .. . . . My std, was ugly
Tasting session @ Budapest. hazy amber/red pour with a thin off white head, tart raspberry aroma, taste has tart raspberry, sharp citrus, some wood.

Draught at Toronado. Hazy ruby red color, white head. Sour taste with raspberries, white currants, tart, earthy notes, acidic notes, wheat and grass. Sour finish with raspberries, white currant, tart, wheat, earthy notes and grass. Exquisite framboise.

On tap at Harrys Hofbrau in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is very strong raspberries with rich / tangy fruit sugar depth. Taste is fruit up front that quickly moves to tart then dry oakiness. Some mild funk mixed with fresh fruit, oakiness and a deep fermented raspberry tang. Had this back-to-bak with their Red Poppy Ale and enjoyed this one much more (had a richer / fuller fruit component I felt was missing from the Red Poppy).
Draft at the source on 6/29/2016. Amber/ruby color with an off-white head. Aroma is fruity, vinous, and tart. Taste is raspberry, dark berry, red wine, vinegar, and wood notes. Very tart.

Aroma: extremely fruity and tart; Appearance: very dark red with thin white head that dissipates quickly; Taste: follows nose; very tart; Palate: medium body with long, sweet and tart taste; Overall: good but overwhelming; would like a little tamer sour ale.
Draft at the Lost Abbey 10th Anniverary Party. Dark pour with lots of yummy sour notes on both the nose and the aroma. Fruity and tart. My favorite kind of beer

Pours brown copper color, haze with creamy beige long lasting (practically till last swallow). Aroma: hint of caramel, fruity notes of raspberries, grapes, some vinegar notes, vanilla...
Flavor: fruity, with notes of raspberries, grape, hint of wood, vanilla, caramel. Some acidity and tannins from fruits enhance the dryness, so beer seem drier than it is.
Body is moderate medium, medium to high carbonation.

Light reddish orange, cloudy. Light tan head. Light sour, raspberry nose, slight honey. Tart, quite sweet without being overpowering. Medium body, quite syrupy. Fairly carbonated, quite acidic. Excellent.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle in trade. Nice mohageny red pour. Aroma is acid fruit with some tartness. Taste has some bitterness up front from the oak barrels Im guessing but the finish is amazing tart raspberry. Really amazing stuff.

Amber with ruby tint color. Sticky dense peach color head. 
Aroma: very bright, tart. raspberry, sour and malty, a liitle spicy, with hint of candies.
First sip very sour. But then more complex with medium bitterness ans sweetness. Finish - barrel bitter notes. Really nice sour ale!
From tap at Himmeriget. Hazy amber colour with a small white head. Aroma and flavour of acidic, raspberries, malt, spice and caramel.

Botte at chmielarnia. Dark red color, small head. Aroma of sour raspberries, acidic, wine vinegar. Taste is strong sour, quite sweet with vinegar character. Flavor of wine, wine vinegar, raspberries, cherries, lemon.

(on tap @ Himmeriget) Poured at fridge temperature into a small footed tulip. Left to sit on the counter for half an hour for aroma to develop. The body seems to be murky and brownish with little tan head that fades somewhat leaving mostly film and lace. Already when poured the beer had an extremely compelling raspberry flavour that makes it hard to concentrate on anything behind it. There could be some malts though. Once it goes in your mouth it becomes complex however. The framboise is clearly felt in the palate as the aromatic qualities enter the nostrils while the tongue detects a certain sweetness followed by a protracted tart finish. Its a combination that works for me.

10-FEB-2016, draft @Himmeriget oppening.
Hazy amber with a low head.
Aroma is cherry, acid, Wood, wine. Taste the same, very cherry-oud bruin-like, even a Little licorice. Very tart with a long and fruity finish. Complex and fantastic.
woody, vanilla, caramel, hay, cherries, raspberries, brown, hazy, tan foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium sourness, full body, sticky, soft carbonation, long finish, bitter,

Bottle from Sbartholomew2. The Lost Abbeys Framboise de Amorosa 8.5%

This beer differs from the others in that it is an American sour as well as being more of a reddish brown than they pink-red you usually get from a raspberry beer. It kind of reminds me of an Oud Bruin.

The aroma is quite a rich acidic/acetic tartness and even has a ripe banana edge to the raspberry jam. 

The flavor is tart acidic raspberries with a jammy sweet character that finishes dry and a little bit gassy. A touch of oak is also evident as well, the carbonic edge is very sharp.

Good and uniquely different from the Belgian raspberry beers but it seems gassy and too sharp in the palate.

Pours copper-red, bit of foam, not much though. Aroma has rasberry full on, sort of feels like fresh rasberry jam that I picked by myself when I was a kid. Taste is intensely sour, rasberry there, not too sweet, acidity cleaning the pallet. Totally full on framboise, real nice and lovable.

Pours hazy brown with small light brown head. Aroma is raspberries, cherry, red wine, wood, funk. Medium sweet, quite tart, vinegarish still quite fresh and balanced. Medium body, almost oily texture, fizzy, almost aggressive carbonation, astringent finish. Good.
Draught at Harrys Hofbrau in San Jose. Wonderful beer with tartness throughout. Beautiful pour with minimal head.

From bottle, shared with MrOrla and Lem. Pours hazy red with a white head. Aroma of cranberries, light funky, slight sour but also a sweet aroma. Taste is really sour, tart, funky barnyard, red berries, currants, wauw!!

Keg at Route CBC, CBC Clapham, 02/10/15. Reddy brown coloured pour with a lasting cream y / pink head. Aroma is jammy raspberry fruit, little tart, some brown bready malts. Flavour is composed of sticky jammy strawberry and raspberry fruit, tart fruit, woody tannin, spicy orange tangy finish. Palate is medium bodied, sweet and sour, lingering tart finish.

fabelagtigt bryg! Kunne jeg gøre kvad, havde denne øl bestemt fortjent et par strofer. Utrolig velbalanceret syre og tilpas tør som det pergament kvadet burde gøres på. 
Proppen er ægte kork.

At Maakuns. Bottle got from Firma Bier. Brownish cloudy pink haze pour. Off white pinkish head. Raspberry woodglue, cottage cheese/curd, yeasty funkk going on amidst a nice spice-blend, flowery as well. Fiercely sour with some sweet fruitiness in there. Milky and gluey texture. Fizzy carbo. Good stuff. Red/brown sour like stuff.

Bottle shared massive thanks to sjogro. Slight hazy deep amber close to mahogany with short lasting beige head that leaves lots of lacing. Lots of sour red berries and raspberries, brown bread, overripe strawberries, poppy seeds and some sesame seeds. Light hay and funk with a touch of red wine vinegar. Sour lactic notes coming up after a few minutes. Medium sour with just a touch of sweetness and bitterness. Medium bodied with a bit fizzy carbonation. Nice one!

Shared 12.7 oz. bottle poured to snifters, showing a slightly hazed, walnut/brownish gold color, with a modest & fleeting layer of tan head foam, with more persistence to the thin ring, and light spots of lacing. The nose was light yeastiness, raspberry puree, some spice, oaky/woody hints, and a tart to sour nature. The taste was similar notes, medium bodied, dry, with lively spritz, and a seltzery/wisp of salt character to the carbonation. Well done!

Bottle. Ruby mahogny in color with an off-white head. Funky notes, some raspberry and hints of malts and oaked cherries in aroma. Quite nice. Hints of vinegar as well. Tart mouthfeel. Funky notes again in taste, but the raspberries steps up here nicely after awhile. Red berries and some wooden notes in the end. Nice one.

Oct 2015 - Keg at Route CBC, Clapham, as Lost Abbey Framboise de Amorosa. Dark orange / brown, still, lightly sparkling, small foamy tan head. Aroma is raspberry, light vinegar, cherry. Nice. Body is light, tingly carbonation, smooth. Thin body. Taste is similar to the aroma with raspberry, malt vinegar, metallic finish. Quite tasty.

Bottle shared at a tasting. Thanks Jon! Pours a copper with a one-finger head of foam that lasts throughout. Very clear raspberry nose with oak and some light vanilla and grass. Light body with medium carbonation and a dry, sour mouthfeel. Hides the abv fairly well. A raspberry bomb on the palate with so much juicy flavor. A wonderful sour brown that accomplishes exactly what it sets out to do.
Bottle, thanks Jon. Big raspberry, pastry, almond aroma. Great. Taste is good, very fruity, raspberry, good stuff, light sourness.

Poured into a wine glass showing copper rust with half a finger of clean white foam. 

The nose shows big and heavy raspberry vinegar and a moderately intense oak background. 

The palate is lightly carbonated and light bodied. Highly tart with a very good raspberry forwardness balanced by a harmonious and large oak and vanilla background.
Hazy red-brown with medium dirty pink creamy head. Sweetsour raspberry aroma. Strong fruity sourness of raspberry, some touch of sweet. Sour aftertaste.
Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; hazy amber/red pour with a thin off white head, tart raspberry aroma, taste has tart raspberry, sharp citrus, some wood.
Cloudy dark red, big off reddish head. Aroma has some leather, oak, raspberries. Taste is sour, with fizzy carbonation. Nice american sour.
Sour&bitter. Unclear reddish brown of color. An aroma of acetone, fruits and red fruits. A flavor of acetone and fruits.

Bottle @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Nice head with good duration. Color is amber/orange. Aroma and taste are rich raspberries, lactose acid, rich fruits, brett, malt and hops. Lovely sour finish. Semi plaque remover.

Bottle. Pours murky red/brown with a big fizzy brown head. Aromas of fresh raspberries, raspberry pits, lactic, light funk, vinegar, oaky vanilla. Taste is damn tart, lactic, vinegar, funk, dry, oaky, fresh raspberries, dark malty notes. God damn this is good!

Keg at Route CBC, CBC Clapham, 02/10/15.
Hazed reddish amber with a decent beige covering.
Nose is tarte cherries, red berry must, spice, big raspberry tang, straw, funky, pissy.
Taste comprises raspberry pips, straw, bitter red berry compote, earthy, wood must, tarte acidic rise.
Medium body with a little bite, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Solid sour.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: 27.5cl bottle served in a teku. Pours deep pinkish red with a nice bubbly head which has a hint of pigment from the barrel and raspberries. Aroma is massive raspberries with a nice tartness rather than the usual sweetness associated with fruit beers, Taste is sweet raspberries which almost immediately turns to a puckering tartness and a good kick of sour in the finish. Very juicy and oaky with an almost red wine quality but the perfect mouthfeel and carbonation make this into a phenomenally rounded and balanced beer. Exactly what I expected from the brewerys deScription which is high praise indeed as only too often am I disappointed by the hype of a beer.

Bottle from cervezalandia online. Dark rose, red color. Thin white head. Medium high sourness, medium bitterness, low to medium sweetness. Flavour is raspberries, chocolate, balsamic vinegar, wood, barnyard.

Neat brown color with a reddish tone to it. Poured nicely carbonated with an off white head. The head dissipated pretty quick but left a decent lacing. Aromas were real complex. They had some light malts and caramel with big raspberries. Somewhat tart on the toungue then some mild malts balanced out the tartness. Along with the rad berries there was a medley of other fruity flavors from the fermentation. Some cherry notes along with some sor apples. Finished with a mild body.

Bottle. Pours a murky, rusty brown/amber with a fizzy, off white to light rusty brown head. Aroma has extremely tart raspberry, bit of funk, leather, slight oaky vanilla, darker malts. Fresh raspberries as well. Taste is very very sour, dry funky, fruity, vanilla, vinegar, tart raspberries, leading to a long, dry finish. Juicy and sparkling texture and a very high carbonation.

On keg at Route CBC. Another of the top beers in the festival for me. Pours dark pink/purple to red, with a small white head. Nose is big fresh fruit raspberry, little malt vinegar, sour and tart, big berry fruit, slight funk, slight mustiness. Taste is big fresh raspberry, malt vinegar, big berry tartness, vinegar sourness. Nicely balanced with the fruit winning over the vinegars to dominate. Some mustiness and maybe touch of wood barrel mustiness.

375ml bottle enjoyed @ home. Pours murky reddish brown with a bubbly tan head. Aroma is raspberries and lots of it, sour cherries an oak. Flavour is medium sour. Full bodied, average carbonation. Finish is sour and raspberries.
Bottle enjoyed on my birthday. Pours a dark reddish brown with minimal beige head. Aroma was fruity with a nice tartness. Taste of a balanced tartness with berries. Definitely amazing.
Wonderful raspberry from brown red pour with one finger head. Flavor of red wine and raspberries. Nice oakiness and great yeast character. Finished very tart and crisp birth raspberries lingering.

Bottle to taster
Dark fruit, cherry, lemon, hint of lacto. Deep red, almost brown with a long lasting, light tan, frothy head. Taste is cherry, raspberry, and very sour and then a near sweetness.

Refrigerated 12.7 oz. brown bottle corked and capped from mashmaster. Translucent reddish medium brown with small off-white head. Aroma is nice tart, medium body, low carbonation, and very little lacing. Taste is some tart cherries, oak, earthy, and some cheese.  Hoped for more.
Hazy brown pour white head 1/4 inch head. Share acidic nose with loads of raspberries. Tart flavor with a great malty balance. Caramel and red fruits in finish,

Grumlig kola mörk färg, med snabbverkande grådaskiga bubblor, hallon å sur, syrlig doft, i min smak ganska sur/ syrliga hallon med mörk malt

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottke at home. Pours hazy red, with a biege head. Aroma of raspberry, funk, ocean, light wood, barn. Taste is funk, sour, ripe fruit, raspberry, barn. Funky lingering finish
Pours red brown with a cream hued head. Nice funk nose. Taste is sour with some berries coming and going. Body is light with good carbonation and the acid burn lingers.

Nice sour raspberry flavor and aroma, Ive had this a number of times over the years, going back to the original launch, and it seems to me that much of the fresh raspberry character that I loved in earlier versions is no longer present. That said its still a nice sour. I paired this with a Spanish Manchego cheese and it did not pair well, I think that a Brie, or a Humboldt Fog, or possibly a Gorgonzola would have been a better choice.

Vintage 2015, on tap at the brewery. Hazy brown-amber-reddish color with hardly any head. Aroma is sweet raspberries with slight funk. Taste is sweet raspberries, great fruit tartness, a full body, and some serious sour finish. Carbonation is medium. Awesome, despite the higher sweetness compared to what I?m used from Belgium?s top Framboises.

12.7 ounces bottle shared @King Arthur Pub (Ciampino). Ruby-copper appearance with a big off-white head. Aroma is fantastic! Raspberry, red fruits, wild mint, balsamic notes, wild yeasts, wow! Flavour is impressive too, rich and complex, light sweet at first with a fresh fruity sourness, some tartness with a light touch of vinegar. Medium body, medium carbonation. A real masterpiece!

Bottle, thanks to Homer. Cheers! Deep brown with red highlights. Small off-white head that quickly settles. Nice jammy nose. Plenty of tart fruit filling. Black raspberry, cherry skin. Mellow acidic funk. The flavor strikes a nice sweet/tart balance. Never too harsh or difficult to drink. Plenty of meaty raspberry. Fruit leather. Some pennies. Medium body, active carb. Quite pleasant.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet. Brownish dark red. Small offwhite head. Aroma of berrys, some funkiness, mint, barnyard. Tart, berrys, fruity, notes of hay, herbs, citrus on the palate. High carbonation, medium mouthfeel. This beer is a challenge. Halfway in the bottle me and the beer agreed, and i fell in love.
Bottle, pours a brownish-mahogany red. Very tart up front and throughout, with a little bit of raspberry in it. Not really sure what else there is to say but its awesome.

On tap at the source. Pours a light brown. Lots of raspberries and sweet fruit in the aroma. Lemony and sweet. Very tart. Lots of berries. Really great. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Vintage bottle shared with Mortlach and Gianluca at King Arthur pub in Ciampino-Italy. Pours amber-ruby hazy, beige persistent head. Nose: wow! Yeast, red fruit, socks, mint, after rain pine. Mouth: juicy sour notes of wild strawberries, wood. Fantastic!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Poured garnet light brownish red, super lively head brought out all the great fruity aromas of raspberry and cherry, pretty tart but mostly fruit and some delicate malts.

Bottle from brewberry Parisdark ruby brown with beige lacing. Earthy tart cider vinegar, lacto, red fruitand Christmas cake nose, redolent of rodenbach charactere rouge. Similarly continues in taste, though a bit less refined, strawberry more than raspberry, pretty acetic with acidic finish. Decent but not quite up to the Flanders reds. Pickled egg notes.

Bottle. Pours light hazy dark red, with a finger thick creamy reddish head. Aroma is really nice and tart raspberries, as well as dark spices, light funky brett with wooden notes and hints of leather. Medium body, with average to fizzy carbonation. Flavour is tart and fruity with raspberries, red and blackcurrants, apples and grapes, as well as wooden bretty notes with cedar and tobacco, oak barrels and tannins. Nice tart and fruity finish.

Flaska från Galatea/Craftbeer. Tack för att jag fick vara med och måla Daniel! Det stod 8,5% abv på min flaska. Rödbrunmurrig färg med lågt beige skum. Fantastisk stor söt hallondoft, sommarvarma hallon med lite trä, jäst och syrlighet i bakgrunden. Stor söta bärig smak men den knivskarpa syra biter snabbt ifrån och skapar balans mot sötman även om syran lätt drar längsta strået. Det är fantastiskt gott men syran är på gränsen till för vass.

UPDATED: DEC 2, 2014 May 4th, 2013 - Breweries have taken to holding special festivals where they get to release small batches to the public on a small scale. Its a controlled frenzy, but the atmosphere is always light and festive. But Lost Abbeys Anniversary party was on a totally different level. All the beers on tap were rare, delicious and exquisite. This was an afternoon to remember, partly for the sheer volume of alcohol consumed, but more because of the serial miracles each glass offered. I began the day with the Frambose de Amarosa, assured that it was an awesome and sweet place to begin. In the glass it is a beautiful apple red skin color with a slight head, and a heavy carbonation that gives it a polished texture in the tungsten lighting of the tasting room. Raspberry comes off on the nose, with a nice tart, raspberry pie filling scent, and a light and vapory aroma thats impossible to ignore for the conversation around me. The flavor has gobs of strawberry jam, as if dotting my tongue with the thick, goopy sugar, but its still dry and sophisticated. So, perhaps a farmers market jam? The light bitterness of strawberry seeds can be tasted as well, adding on the fresh sweetness of ripe strawberry, the clean, slightly sweet botanical touch of apple skins, and shakes of cinnamon, all space and a quenching carbonation. This is just the start for the day, but its an epic beginning, and sets a high bar for succeeding beers to meet.

September 10th, 2012 - Most of the beers I enjoyed for my birthday came off a line of samplers from the nearby Rock Bottom - La Jolla. But I wanted to end my birthday on a more exceptional note, and that meant turning to the pricier, but always delicious (and adventurous) beers from Lost Abbey. Todays treat (indeed, a desert and a drink wrapped in one) is the exotically named Framboise de Amorosa, proudly proclaimed from a label decorated with images mimicking classic art. It pours with a huge, pillowy meringue textured head, which on closer inspection (and a few more lit light bulbs) blushes with a healthy pink rose hue. The smell reveals berries - baskets and bushels and branches bent by the sheer weight of berries. Theres the mellowness of ripe raspberries, the tanginess of fresh strawberries, a touch of water, the light mineral flavor of mineral water, a shade of light cocoa (blending with the berries to produce the flavor of chocolate dipped fruit) and some white wine qualities too, likely the acidity from some of Lost Abbeys signature oak aging. The flavor, like some of the high notes in the aroma, is at its core, tart and acidic. There was clearly an effort to guard against letting this brew get too sweet, instead relying on more translucent fruit flavors and sour notes to build a beautiful flavor profile. Each sip begins with a fresh bout of watermelon flavors, with an undertone of oak shrieking that outlasts all the other tastes well into the aftertaste. And as it warms, the Framboise de Amorosa takes on a light, lovely wood scent that reminds me of the grounds around Japans famous Ise Shrine, where structures are regularly rebuilt and refinished. Here and there amongst the sips and burps are some sweeter strokes, like raspberry flavors, and some light cream richness and sweetness, but this is definitely a sour and tart beer foremost, or as I write at the end of my notes here, "An American Cantillon."

Draughts at Lord Hobo (night before Zwanze 2013) and Publick House, 3/20/14Bright red pour, good clarity and a small off white, cherry flesh-tinted head that shows moderate retention.Raspberries, of course, in the nose are joined by a cedary note that I always associate with the raspberry seeds. Very light on the acetic acids for a sour brown, with streaks of oily leather, vegetal notes (again from the raspberries) and a good dose of vanilla. Some lightly sweet brown sugar and toffee notes linger, with more leather, horseblanket and prunes emerging as it warms. Nice and dry, but maybe so intensely sour as to turn off those who arent complete sourheads.Flavor matches the nose quite well, with some lightly sweet pale malt sugars mixing with the dry, somewhat astringent raspberry seed-like flavors. Some sharpness from the acids and the malts are a bit scratchy but it softens and sweetens some on the end, thanks to the acetic acids and light brown malts. Wonderful rasberry flavor, very very authentic and well-attenuated with no syrupiness or residual sweetness. The raspberry flavor reminds me much of Rose de Gambrinus.

Bottle shared by alexsdad06. Poured a hazy reddish copper color with a mostly lasted frothy white head that mostly lasted with excellent lacing. Moderate to heavy sour yeast and tart berry aroma. Medium to full body with a tingly texture and soft carbonation. Medium to heavy sour & tart fruit flavor with a medium to heavy tart & sour finish of moderate to long duration. This is a standout beer.

Pours a muddy rusty deep raspberry color with a quickly fading bubbly khaki foam. The nose is huge sweet raspberry, vinous bright acidity and a touch of malted caramel in the background. The palate is a bit overwhelming... huge sour raspberry, dirty wood, mushroom, vinegar... a bit underwhelming and just sour. The flavors are muddy and not very balanced. Not a fan.
Sampled at gabf from a bottle. pours a dark amber with zero head. raspberry taste and aroma.
Sample at the 2013 GABF. Pours a muddy brown with an ecru head. Barnyard funk aroma. Tart raspberry flavors. Lingering tart finish.

Raspberry sour, bit acid.. oaky. Uhh.. usually these kind of beers is more plastic and chemical.. this one is pure beauty. Wasted with my girlfriend.. liked every sip. btw.. nice appearance as well. Maybe price/performance is not the best, but really.. must have

2013 edition. Massive foamy tan head that stays for ever. Reddish purple opaque color. Aroma is a massive nose of raspberries with a hint of wood. The flavor is initially raspberries but follows with super tart funkiness. This is a one of a kind great beer.
Awesome raspberry sour aroma. Dark red/brown color. Tastes very sour and tart with a slight sweetness. Flavors of raspberry, grapefruit, green grapes, vinegar, and green apples. Very tasty sipper.

Bottled. Pours red-brown with a small, beige head. Aroma of strawberrie notes,wood, brett and caramel. Sour flavor that ens up tart. Medium bodied, watery to oily text. and flat carb. An excellent sour.

UPDATED: SEP 22, 2013 375 ml bottle. Hazy red with lasting reddish beige head. Aroma loads of raspberries, lactic acid, oak, vinegar and brett notes. Taste is rather intense with lots of raspberries, lactic acid, tartness and medium sweetness. Finish is tart and fruity. Really nice!

375ml bottle. Chunky thick cherry red body. Oliy residue for a head. Fresh raspberry aroma. A very nice American sour, but lacks the refinement of a Belgian classic example. Big juicy raspberry tones. Shows its ABV, the alcohol is quite apparent. Packs a real punch, this has some bite.

Bottle at the Beer Temple, Amsterdam. Poured a cloudy brown amber with a thin broken, off-white head. The aroma is crisp, yeasty and acidic. The flavour is medium sweet/sour, with some super acid, grapefruit and yeast on the highly refreshing palate. A super beer that would definitely convert any non-believers.

Bottle shared at Beer Temple. Pours cloudy red brown with a small tan head. Aroma of massive tart raspberry, light barnyard. Flavour is light sweet and moderate acidic. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.
375 ml. bottle. Pours reddish purple with a large (gusher) light pink head. Aroma of tart fruit, funk, and wood. Taste is tart raspberries, funk, oak, citrus, and malt. Very sour, very good.

(Bottle) Hazy reddish brown colour with frothy, beige head. Fruity, sour nose with notes of raspberries, red fruit, balsamic vinegar and oak wood. Quite concentrated aromas. Fruity, tart taste with raspberries, vinegar, red-currant, caramel, oak wood and a tart finish with a slightly acidic vinegar burn. Medium body, with a certain sweetness. Its quite straightforward and not overly complex, but oh ... what a lovely beer. Excellent!
Brown colored with a red note. Clear. Heavy aroma of raspberries, vanilla, acid, faint caramel. Flavor is acid, solvents, some sugars. Dry, light astringent.

Bottle @ SlackerMads. Pour unclear red with a lasting and good lacing beige frothy head. Aroma is dominated by raspberries, almond, lactic, oak, vinegar and hints of brett. Taste is rather intense and moderate sweet and tart. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. Finish is short with raspberries and a late acidic burn in the throat.

Bottle. Unclear reddish brown with a medium sized diminishing off white good lacing head. Mouthwatering sour brown and raspberry nose. Raspberries up front, then some sour red notes kick in before the raspberries appear again lingering raspberry finish. Medium sweet and lactic sour, oak, dry finish. Intense, delicious.
Reddish brown pour, off white head. Raspberry tart and nice sour flavors. A nice and beautiful brown sour. Flavorful and good.

A - pours a cloudy muddled maroon that looks like berry juice with 1 finger fluffy head that lasts for days. S - nice rich tart fresh raspberries, raspberry seeds and skin, and apple/cran/ras juice. Some vinegar and light funk. Overall very sweet aromas. M - acetic up front. Very sour right away. Vinegar, oak, lemon, first. Palate is tart fresh raspberries, with bitter skins and seeds. The palate rolls to sweet berry cobbler, simple sugar and lemon. O - a really nice framboise. Balanced and not über aggressive. 4.1

Skjuter som ett skott och halva flaskan flyger ut över både mig och på golvet. Neeeej! Inte bra, men kul show. Smakar bra, riktigt jäkla bra. Hallonbomb. Härlig mousse och lite lägre syra än sin duellpartner cantillon lou pepe.

Color Rubí oscuro con tonalidades caoba, espuma rosada generosa. Aromas intensos de fruta ácida y uva. En boca es compleja, con una densidad media, de inicio pica bastante hasta que un dulzor afrutado que ayuda a equilibrar la acidez achampanada que invade el paladar y que, con un regusto duradero, muestra al final su cara más afrutada. Una fiesta.
Bottle, thanks Mike. Pours dark purple brown with off white head. Nice funky aroma, light vinegar. Funky raspberry flavour. Very fizzy and quite tart. Delish.
sweet framboise aroma,red, clear, off white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, fizzy, dry finish.

Type: 8-oz. draft 
Glass: Tulip
From: KnB Wine Cellars in Del Cerro (San Diego), Calif. 
Price: $7.00 (Wednesday deal) 
Purchased: Aug. 7, 2013
Consumed: Aug. 7, 2013
Misc.: N/A

Poured a plum, reddish brown color with one finger of gray head when I got it. Light spots lacing on the sides. No retention.

Smelled dark cherries, plum, raspberry, Red-Hooded Slut shot, grape and cranberry.

Tasted even better than the nose. Got raspberry, cranberry, dark cherry, Sweet Tarts and Smarties. So smooth.

Medium body. Oily texture. Average-to-soft carbonation. Long, smooth finish.

I always think this style is good, but this went down easy. So smooth.

UPDATED: MAR 19, 2016 small bottle from ølbutikken @134 dkk. unfortunately a gusher so 1/3rd of the beer gushed into the sink before i could grab a glass and save the rest. Open this in a bucket to save the expensive beer. cloudy red, fluffy red head.Strong aroma of fresh raspberries, sour beer,, wild yeasts, balanced and loads of sour raspberries.Flavor is very sour, quite well rounded, with a clear taste of raspberries, but also leather and funk, quite acidic, but not really phenolic. [8,2,7,3,17]
re-rate 2016-3-19. bottle from kihoskh. clear dark red to brown, small offwhite to brown head (3)  fruity and malty and leathery aroma, fruits are a bit sugary. a bit bittersweet in a way. 8 to 7.  Flavor is very sourish, strong citrussy note, some fruits, some leather,  tastes like one of the better belgian frambose lambics. quite sour. 7 to 8. palate stays, overall stays.

P: Just a bit of a gusher pours deep reddish/dark purple with a large white slight pink head that foams up huge but quickly disappears like a sodas head would. S: Raspberries, oak, some alcohol, somewhat earthy with bananas. T: Lots of oak and raspberries penetrate the tastebusds, with some wet grass. Sours and citrus also follow through with a final touch of hay. M: Sweet and sour. Over carbonated. O: Delightful beer just a bit too much carbonation.

Bottle-Pours cloudy, penny-copper, with a thin pinkish head that dissipates quick. Raspberry, sour punch straws, funky. Sour, raspberry tart with somewhat medicinal (alcohol-ly dry finish. I like this beer because I like sours but this is not my favorite.
On tap at Taps in Petaluma. Pours a bright red color without much head. Very sour that lasts the whole taste with a good flavor of raspberries.

Cloudy pinkish brown with a massive pink head that leaves some nice lacing. Aroma is raspberries, sour candy, red liquorice, touch of sweet funk and rose petals. Full bodied, tart on the palate with a sweet background, lingering sweet fruity finish. Taste is raspberries, gummy bears, apple cider vinegar, red currants. Yum!

Bottle, 2013 ed. Pours deep hazy reddish/brown with a massive tan head. Excellent retention/lace. Aroma of raspberry, funk, dust, barnyard, balsamic. Taste is quite tart, sour, fruity, lightly acetic, dusty. Palate is soft, slick, tart/sour finish. Really nice.

Pours red brown with high pink white head 
Aromas of raspberries, caramel, bretta
Taste is lovely sour from bretta and raspberries where caramel malts builds up a good malty backbone

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Larry, cloudy reddish brown pour with really nice white head. Big strong aromas of raspberries, strawberries and sour funk. Taste is raspberries, tartness builds on the palette, good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

375ml bottle thanks to Tooch4321 
Appearance: Pours clear dark brown with a medium sized frothy beige head and good lacing 
Aroma: Tart fruit, oak, woody and vinegar 
Taste: Tart dark fruit, oak, some mild sweetness and finishes super dry 
A nice sipper.
Sampled 2 different vintages during Philly Beer Week. I believe it was 2011 and 2012? The older version was more complex and pleasing, but both were outstanding.

Bottle. Frothy offwhite good mostly lasting head. Amber colour. Moderat malty and light hoppy complex aroma. Raspberry notes. Moderate bitter wonderfull flavor. Raspberry and oak. Average moderate bitter finish. Oily palate.

Pours dark brown with a thick, light brown head that doesn't go away. Aroma of raspberries and funk. Taste is very sour, raspberries and funk. Slightly sweet yet very tart. Amazing beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle poured deep pink with no head.  Smell was amazing, reminded me of hommage, raspberry jammy.  Flavor lacked the depth of the aroma but was still tasty.  Great sweet to sour balance.  Would love to try an earlier batch

375 ml shared with my sis.  Pours a cloudy dark ruby red color with a big frothy head that fades very slowly.  Aroma is huge sour funk with raspberries.  Taste is extremely tart raspberries, so much that it hurts jaw because Im clenching it.  I never know never how to review sours because Im relative inexperienced with them.  This isnt a bad beer really but its just not my thing.  I could barely finish my 6 oz pour because how extremely tart it was.

On tap at Nodding Head.  Now this is more like it!  Tart raspberry aroma with a very underripe cranberry up the nose.  Pours bright hazy red with a solid but fast head.  Taste is wonderfully intense with fresh raspberry, tart cherry and a slight oaky funk.  I love this.  They had last years batch on tap but this is much better fresh.  Far more tart and fruity.

UPDATED: NOV 22, 2014 Pours a very murky brune color with almost no head.  Aromatic notes of raspberry jam, vinegar, some funk and a whole lotta sour.  Taste is head slappingly sour with a very meaty quality to it.  Fuck, this is really good.  The finish is unique and refreshing with a whole fistful of lady-boy cock.  pretty damn good.
Bottle via trade. Murky reddish brown pour with an off white head. Tart raspberry nose with some vinegar. Full flavored - great fruit taste. Awesome brew.
Delicious fruit sour, just the right amount of raspberry flavor and a great tarttness to it. Super balanced, nice sour finish, excellent.

Pours reddish brown with a pink head. Fruity, raspberries, sour, lemon, a little bit of yeast. Very nice sour beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tart and sweet smell. Pink head. Nice tingle with the tartness and a sweet fruity medium. Little dry on the finish.. great sour.. I think ill have another.
On tap at capitol beer and tap room. Pours red with white head. Aroma is strong funk. Taste is extremely tart with some raspberry. Lingers tart on palate for a while

Red tinted brown color, nice pink bed of foam on top, great lacing. Some floaties made it into the glass while pouring. Delicious sweet/tart raspberry smell, reminiscent of raspberry licorice. The oak lends its characteristics as well but in a more subtle way. Flavor-wise, the dryness of the oak is much more prominent. Very tart, tingly in the mouth, leaves a very pleasant light fruity after taste. A+++, would drink again.

Impressive.  Dark red, decent head retention and lacing.  Super tart, with a lot of raspberries.  Manages to be really fruity and really funky.  Lots of fruit in the nose and front of the palate.  Finishes very sour and dry.  Really fun to drink, and delicious.

Appears reddish brown with ring of lighter tinted color. Smell is raspberry, sour aromas, lemon. Taste is very tart raspberries,salty. Nice and sour with a very dry aftertaste. Highly carbonated with light body.
Poured from a 375ml bottle, thanks to the Boise crew. Raspberry, sweet, slight bitterness. I would have liked a little more raspberry, felt like the balance was off.

pours a red/brown. Thick head, with a raspberry tint to it. Sour oak on the nose. Sour, but not overwhelming. The brown ale and oak notes are still visible, and the raspberry is there too in the perfect way. Fantastic.

Bottle 375ml.
Pours dirty dark pink/brown with medium head. Aroma is of fruits, raspberries jam, sweet. Very interesting. Taste is of fruits, raspberries, alcohol, sligth malt, sourness (stays under controll). Some acidity, no vinegar. Palate: Ligth body. Overall: Very good. Fruity. Nice sour, not too cloying.

Bottle (375 ml). Traded by pandableh, thanks Daniel! Pink-brown (not a beautiful color) with a  small but thick and fully lasting beige head and good lacing. Aroma if full of raspberry jam along with other red fruit notes, oak and slight sourness. Taste is moderately sweet and sour with red fruits and a little oak presence. Mouthfeel is slightly acetic and dry. This is an excellent Sour Ale. Intensely fruity, not too acetic, great balance between sweet and sour. I would drink this again anytime!

From bottle & most recently on draft. Prefer the bottled version. Big, fluffy white head. Smells & tastes of raspberries, tartness, slight vinegar. Finishes fairly dry. Great American version of this classic style!

375 bottle from trade with jtclockwork.  Cheers, James.  Pours a pondwater brown color with a white head.  The head is so effervescent that it reminds me of the "Snap, Crackle, and Pop" rice crispies.  Nose is vinegar, lacto tartness, raspberries, berry skins, and some mild funk.  Flavor follows with vinegar, lacto, and funk up front, sweet berries and berry skins in the mid and vinegar and funk on the back end.  Very sour, definitely the heart of an oud bruin.

Bottle shared by Kiefer.  Super pumped to try this offering.  Pours something that looks like a bloody mary with too much vodka.  Super murky brown/red.  Aroma is heavy shour cherries and hints of raspberries that perhaps can be seen as some noticeable sweetness.  Taste is acidic cherries, tartness, raspberries, earthy.  Medium body.  This was killer and is holding up amazingly.  F-yea!

Bottle. Pours deep cloudy reddish brown with a large creamy pink-beige head that dissipates very slowly and leaves nice lacing. Aroma is tart cherry, wood, raspberry, funk, Brett, lemon. Flavor is the same, light sweet and quite tart, with a dry tart finish. Medium body, strongly prickly champagnelike carbonation in the mouth. Very interesting beer.

Pours a pale ruby color with a large light pink head.  Aroma has vinous, oaky raspberry with a hint of tartness.  Flavor is super tart raspberry...puckeringly tart!  Mouthfeel is light and the finish is very dry and lingers with super tart raspberries.

At the ekstedt vintage tasting on December 28, 2012. This was a pause beer, not a vintage vertical, 12.7 oz bottle, thanks Clyx!Clear brown color, small tan head. Sweet, sour, raspberry scent, also vinegar. Acidic, sweet, sour, apple, vinegar taste. Medium mouthfeel, very low bitterness. Somewhat spicy and salty aftertaste.
Bottle (375 ml), courtesy of gnoff. Clear ruby with low head. Fresh raspberry aroma, some vinegar, some wood. Light to medium bodied, medium carbonation. Dry with a bit sharp acidity.

Bottle thanks to jtclockwork.  Pours a deep murky red, with a big, slightly pinkish off-white head.   Aroma is raspberries, raspberry syrup, funk, oak.  Taste is an absolute blast of funk and tartness, with some sweetness from the raspberries but not quite enough to balance out the sourness.  Finish is dry, woody.  Light-medium body, tons of carbonation.  One of the more extreme sours Ive had.

Bottle shared by DalzAle. Pours hazy dark amber mahogany with a quick khaki head that fades. Aroma is strong sour raspberries and funk. Taste is really lovely sour raspberries funky with some leather and lactic. Palate is medium slick and drying. Awesome.

Bottle thanks to StFun!  Brownish red pour, tons of carbonation and sediment and a wonderful aroma of fresh ripe raspberries. Flavor is dry raspberries, enough malt to back up some nice sourness.  Clean, crisp, fruity, and pretty nice in every way.  Thanks Josh!
Thanks Greg!! Bottle gushed, but we were prepared. Yeast chunks in the pour, so it wasnt too pretty. Massive raspberry nose, lovely tart and more raspberry goodness. Really nice beer!

On draft at Bigwood 12/6/2012, from notes [2 of 11].

Muddy mahogany color.  Big bubbly ring around edge.  Thin patchy wispy/hazy head in center (like the last bit of fog from a dry ice machine).  Sweet dark fruit aroma when swirled, otherwise tart raspberry.  Not quite floral, but something bucolic, light, and airy about this.  Taste/Palate:  I wish I liked eating fruit more, because my vocabulary is sorely lacking, and all I can say is theres more than raspberry but I dont know what.  The finish blossoms beautifully after a bracing tart start.  Really amazing finish reminiscent of cherry/raspberry pie.  Great lively carbonation and perfect mouth coating.  This is beautiful.  I cant believe how it really seems to bloom in my mouth during each sip.

Bottle shared by Ludvig.

A good sour. Does not excite me that much but still good.
Reddish brown color with an aroma of raspberry, vanilla, and vinegar.  Flavor of strawberry, vanilla, wood, and tart.  Just exceptional!

Pours a hazy and brown beer with an offwhite head. The aroma is malt, caramel, raspberries, vanilla and wood. The flavor follows the nose with additional acidity. The palate is acidic. Overall a good beer.

Dirty brown with little head.  Nice raspberry aroma.  Flavor is terrible, all vingegar.  Overly carbed and aggressive.  Not my thing.

Bottle at Amundsen, september 7th 2012. Dark hazy ruby body, thin offwhite head with a red hue. Aroma of raspberry, cherry, lemon and grain. Murky dark amber.
Sour with notes of brown sugar.
Light raspeberries.

Where the Wild Beers Are 2012. The aroma has yeast and loads of fresh raspberries. This is one of the best aromas I have found in any fruit beer. Sour fruit flavor with yeast. I dont like everything from Lost Abbey but this is an excellent beer.

Acquired in a trade but not sure from where. Shared with my GF in flute glasses. The cork was impossible to remove! Had to break out the pliers. 

A - Poured a very murky amber / plum brown. Lots of cloudiness, 3 finger head that was colored reddish brown and faded too slow.

S - Smells exactly like a Rodenbach Grand Cru w/ Less cherry and more tart raspberries. Nothing more to say. .

T - Interesting. Hints of Apple Cider Vinegar and cherry juice. Hint of oak and burnt rubber.It has this sour astringent quality and acidity thats a turn off. In short, its an okay Flanders Red with raspberries. Its alright .

M - 80% carbontion, medium body. Tart / sweetness that stays around for a while

O - This is drinkable but for the cost and the fact this isnt distributed near me, I wont seek it out again.

Bottle, shared with BBGTC. At last! Ive been looking at this in our cellar for a while, now the geeks finally get to dig in... :-) Pours a deep red-hued orange body with a small off-white head. Complex sour and sweet tones in the aroma; apple vinegar, sweet dark berries, prominent raspberries, oak, hints of prunes and herbs far in the back. Great stuff. Taste is malty red wine-ish vinegar notes (if that makes any sense...at all), intense raspberry tones well balanced against the oaky wood notes, hints of blackcurrants and herbs. Extremely well blended. Full body, soft carbonation. Phenomenal beer, this is. :-)

It may be sacrilege but this didnt do much for me.  The raspberry taste is muted to me.  The Oud Bruin is fine but not any better than others that I have had and it just tasted dull.  No bright tartness  to be found.

Bottle at home with my wife. Pour is murky amber in appearance with a pink tint and small off-white head. Raspberry, tart cherries, wood, light funk, Light vinegar, and plums in the aroma. Taste is very tart upfront, with notes of cherry pit, wood, vinegar, ripe strawberries, light pepper, some wax, and raspberries ending only moderately tart. Not too sweet or sour, yet still having nice touches of both, along with some spice in there to round it out. Creamy mouthfeel with high carbonation. Really nice sour and super drinkable, leaving my mouth feeling tingly and yearning for more. Well-done.
Red with no head. Fruity with sour tones. Fruit ( raspberries) and sour. Medium to full body with a nice sour and sweet after taste.
Pours brown with a beige head. Aroma is caramel, raspberries, light sour notes and sweet notes. Flavour is caramel, acidic, vinegar, raspberries and sour notes.
Stockholm Beer & Whisky Festival 2011. Redbrown beer with a small offwhite head. Fruity viegar, sourish, sugarsweet, raspberry aroma. Fruity and raspberry flavour. I really enjoyed this one :-)

On draft at Capones for the Lost Abbey dinner. Poured a cloudy reddish brown with thin tan-red head and blanket lacing.  Very raspberry, tart lemon, a little funk, with a pucker worthy finish.  Tasty.
Bottle from auction.   Not my favorite style, but good for a sour. I liked the berry / bread flavors. I liked the tart finish, but I wasnt crazy about the big vinegar notes.  Not bad.

0.375l bottle shared with The Tasting Crew. A little treat on this nice evening! The pour on this one is cloudy and deep murky-red-brown with a quickly fading off-white sidesticking head. The aroma? Oh yeah! Lots and lots of berries, plums, raspberries, fermented cherries, ripe strawberries and sour green gooseberries. It has a beautiful sweet and sour thing going on in the aroma, and I also get hints of red wine vinegar with some peppery hints. Amazing. Lets try it. Oh, yeah. Fantastic flavors! So balanced between sour, fruity and sweet! All the stuff found in the aroma can be found in the taste as well. Its light burning in the throat, red wine vinegar, stingy lemon, with a fantastic mouthfeel. Really impressive! 25.07.2012

2010 bottle at an epic tasting by daknole. Pours a hazy amber with a huge, slightly pink head. Beautiful aroma of raspberries and rose petals, which gives it a almost potpourri scent. Mouth-puckering lactic tartness hits the taste buds first before being tempered by a sweet berry finish.
Red copper colour with a small off-white head. Aroma of caramel, a touch of funk, some raspberry and acetone. Dry and harshly acidic flavour with raspberries and vinegar.

12oz bottle shared with friend. poured reddish amber orange color with white head that didnt last long. the initial aroma was of mild sourness and raspberries...the flavor was incredible a perfect blend of fruit and sour and malt...wish i had more of this one..a very unique flavor that hung on the taste buds. not cloyingly sweet or sticky. love this beer.

UPDATED: JAN 5, 2015 Pours coppery amber with a small white head. Aroma is heavy sour but with a solid sweet backbone. Very slight hints of paint-thinner but not unpleasant. Cherries and citruspeel. Taste is awesomely balanced towards the cherry/vinegar without being over the top. But still right at the edge, witch makes it truly great. Hints of caramel maltyness in the back but dominated by the red currant flavour. Body is light with good carbonation. Puckering and very dry.

8/3/9/4/16
Draught at Wood Shop 7. Deep, blood, dark red with brown and lace. Nice framboise nose, huge raspberries, some cream, big fruit. Sweet, but very naturally sweet raspberry flavor, rich fruit, not very sour or funky at all, but lovely fruit.

Bottle courtesy of "hannont". Colour...amber with a thick head. Nose... Sharp, astringent, medicinal raspberries but in a good way!  Palate...man! What an assault on the palate! A very striking bitter burst of underripe raspberries, followed by thymol, eucalyptol and dry, sappy oak that carries through the finish. Over a few minutes the sharpness faded away and exposed ripe raspberries.

Bottle poured a cloudy brown with ruby hues, a small tan head, and notable lacing.  Aroma includes berries, dark fruit, oak, and vanilla.  Taste is well-balanced with tart sour cherry, fruity rasberry, oak, and caramel.  Enjoyable fruit on a crisp finish filled with active carbonation.
bottle thanks dan! pours hazy red with medium off white head. big sour berry aroma. taste was very sour at first but the berry showed off in the finish

Shared by Brad at my tasting on May 29, 2010.
Review from notes.

This beer is ruby-hued with a medium-sized head and a little lacing left stuck on the glass. Tart raspberries and wild yeast make up the aromas. The taste pretty much follows suit. This beer is delicious. Its nice and dry, with an excellent balance of fruit and tart. There is a slight alcoholic note in the finish. I would definitely drink this beer anytime. I really enjoyed it.

Bottle. Pours a solid dark cherry red - completely opaque, with a thick bubbly dirty pink head. aroma of soured raspberries, funk, tart, vinegar, yeast.. Flavour is mainly vinegary - but in a drinkable way, raspberries take a back seat in this beer. Sour, most certainly, but not intensely so. Yeast is detectable in the finish. Exceedingly dry, not as fruity as I was expecting/hoping. Not a sour expert but feel this beer falls victim of hype.

375mL bottle, pours an opaque burgundy with a very large, slowly-dissipating pinkish beige head. Aroma is full of tart raspberries, maybe some other berries, wood, subtle vinegar / acetic notes, and yeast - seems quite dry. Flavour is extremely vinegary, with the tart raspberries being moderate with no sweetness, overshadowed by the acetic notes; also some oaky / woody notes and moderate a funky quality. Basically summarized as a very highly tart raspberry fruit beer coated in a highly acetic / vinegary quality. Very well-made and enjoyable in smaller portions.

Pours brown with red tints...small tan head.
Aroma is musty, a hint of vegetable, tart fruit.
Taste is very tart....sherry-like raspberry and vinegar.
A bit too sour for mt personal taste ....but obviously a well crafted beer for the style.
Bottle.  Musty raspberry and vinegar aroma.  Amber with moderate head.  Tart-sour raspberry and vinegar flavor.   Great blending of the raspberry and sourness.

served in De Ranke Tulip. pours a deep brown with a nice deep maroon glow. like cream and maroon head. amazing retention. chunks of yeast are suspended through out. huge raspberry with light sour lemon and grape. oak really comes through with a nice light scent. lip puckering up front. loads of raspberry through out with a touch of sweetness. nice light oak through out. light hints of vinegar and lemon. light funk, very much hidden however creeps through. a bit dry. lots of carbonation. light body, but full (from the carbonation).
this is amazing, i love it. the raspberry flavor is heavy but never too much.

Bottle. Musty, tart, raspberry balsamic vinegar aroma. Cloudy amber with a small beige head. Sour, tart raspberry, oaky tannic flavor with a light bitter finish. Light body, lively carbonation, very dry finish with an acidic burn in the throat.

Bottle. Light pink tan head on a hazy ruby murky brown. Vinegar, cherry pit, raspberry seeds and ripeness. Dirty sourness with peach, dark tart cherry and raspberry seeds with a very sour vinegary finish that has some slight caramel sweetness in the middle. Lighter body with very vibrant carbonation. Just awesome

355ml bottle. Pours a cloudy toffee colour with a nice thin layer of lace which has a fawny colour. The nose has cherries more than raspberries with a creamy coffee note. The taste has definitely very tart raspberries with a hint of redcurrants and then a touch of chocolate and nuts on the end. The palate is light to medium in body with a tangy texture and a dry finish. Overall, not quite as light and tangy with slightly too much body in this instance.

9th July 2010Cloudy brown beer with a purple hue. Small pink head! Sourish malty and fruity nose. Semi dry palate, Tart fruits, acid worcester sauce. Acid lemon burn on the swallow. Trace of wet wood. This is a good example of sour beers gone silly. Way too sour and acid.

2011 bottle split with the wife.  Pours a ruby/pinkish red color, off-white head, thin collar.  Nose is tart raspberry, funk, oak.  Taste is more of the same, slightly one-dimensional.  Fruity tartness, funk, oak, raspberry.  Light body, good carbonation, tart dry finish. Good, not great.

Bottle at Sunset Beer Co. It's the color a raspberry beer should be, with a funky nose. Taste is all sour raspberry, sweet but tempered. A near perfect sour fruit beer.

2011 Bottle. Pours a nice darker red color with a pink head. Aroma is of sweet and tart raspberries, some caramel, balsamic vinegar, oak and subtle funk. Flavor follows the nose and is fairly tart with nice tart and sweet raspberry flavors, I also get the caramel, balsamic vinegar, a little bit of cherry, oak and subtle funk. The body is medium with a dry mouth feel. Overall a great sour!
Bottle @ Mikkeller Bar. Hazy red with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, heavy raspberry, wood and tart. Flavor is quite sweet and very acidic. Dry and very acidic finish. 120512
Bottle @ MikkellerBar. Very dark brown/red with tiny tan head. Aroma is malt, fruit, raspberries and tart. Flavour is malt, raspberries, tart, sour, wood, little sweet, dry, earth and vinegar.

Beer #3500!
Deep chunky red and brown coloured body with a thick, three centimetre tall pink and light brown head. Zillions of super small bubbles rising from the sides barely noticeable against the almost chocolate milk like glow when held up to a light. Aroma of brilliant sour raspberries, yeast, sugar, cherries, apples, oak and a bit of funk noticeable. Medium-bodied; Assertive sour raspberries up front with a good balance of the sour and sweet portions of the beer with a hint of oak and dryness on the tail end. Aftertaste shows a lot of sour qualities with some good fruit forward tastes and a lot of sweetness lingering in the back with malt and a bit of earth at the very end. Overall, a very well crafted Oud Bruin with a definite sourness that shows nicely. A great choice for a large number beer rating, as this is one of the best styles of beer from one of the best producers in America. I sampled this 37,5 cL split bottle purchased from Olive Tree Market Place in San Diego, California on 05-May-2012 for US$16.99 sampled at home in Washington on 07-June-2012.

UPDATED: FEB 25, 2015 Draught at Eulogy. Dark red purple with a light pink head. Big full raspberry sour. Tremendous! Lots of different levels of sour with only a hint of sweetness. Some earthy leafy notes. Can pretty much taste the whole raspberry bush. Dry sour finish. Medium body. Not quite as full and funky as the cherry version (Red Poppy) which makes it a bit less interesting. Still right up there as one of the great sours around!  Update: Comparing the 2013 against the 2012 vintage at a Lost Abbey event at Nodding Head. Both poured a very cloudy brown. The current one tastes sharper and fuller but the 2012 has opened up more and feels deeper. Maybe just a bit watery. Big sour bite at the end of the 2013. Very smooth finish for the 2012. Look identical but big differences in taste and body. Both great stuff!

Bottle 2012. Pours a deep brown/maroon with huge frothy pink head. Definitely not a flat abbey beer here. Nose is full of raspberry with some wet tin and a medium brett funk. Taste is very fruit forward with the raspberries coming out in the front and then fading at the end to a mild sour finish. The oude bruin elements make for a nice base beer to compliment the fruit. Overall, great fruit forward American sour.

text: Bottle to snifter (thanks Bob). Looks decent; dark with ample head. Smells good; tart and fruity. Tastes pretty good; hearty for a framboise, though (even for an American). Mouthfeel is okay. Pretty good.

Bottle @ Mikkeller bar, thanks to Rasmus and Christer. Pours hazy reddish brown with a small offwhite head. Aroma is lightly sour, yeast, and lots of tart raspberries. Taste is sour, yeast, tart raspberries, light wood. Thin body, lively carbonation, dry and tart finish. 120512
Pours murky tannish red with dirty muddy finger of head. Smell is light raspberry funk. Taste is funky raspberry, wood, flavorful. Nice.

Sampled at an esbls tasting.  A big pink head and a raspberry funk aroma.  Sourness is not huge in the flavor but some vinegar is tasted.  Funkiness and raspberries.  Yeast.  Interesting.

Bottle at OBriens, SD. It pours hazy deep red-brown, with a thin off-white head. The nose is quite sweet overall - raspberry, red grape, cherry and a touch of lemon and green apple tartness. From notes.  Poured from a 375 mL bottle into a tulip.

Framboise de Amorosa pours a cloudy, murky brown color with a raspberry red tint and copper edges.

Dark malts are lost in a funky, raspberry aroma.  Barnyard funk and some leather wrap around a tart, vinegar raspberry and an acidic lemon aroma.

A sweet raspberry flavor starts the flavor out, slowly bringing in a sweet caramel malt flavor.  Next the flavor turns bluntly sour, with the sweetness of the raspberries cut in by a sharp lemon sourness.  The raspberry flavor remains, growing tart and acidic, with just a bit of vinegar.

The body is on the lighter side of medium, with medium carbonation.

Lost Abbey can make some impressive sours, and this beer is right in my wheelhouse.

This is a flemish red not a wild ale. I dont really get any raspberry. Nice sour notes, some vinegar, low fruit. I chilled this near freezing as I remembered a few people with gushers. The cork popped but poured with little tan head that was gone in several seconds. A solid beer. But is it worth what you pay when there are many other comparable beers for much less? not for me.

A crimson blood ale with a reddish crisp head.  The flavors are so varied with the sours and fruits coming through you begin to salavate.  The beer is so complex with notes of fruits and sours that you need a moment of silence of take it all in.  Absolutely worthy of every effort to get.

Pours dark ruby and copper with a very small white head that recedes quickly. Nose is strong lemon and raspberry with earthy grains and soil. Flavor is sweet up front with a strong sour punch on the finish. Mouthfeel is crisp, clean and with a long fulfilling finish. Amazing balance.

Fantastic raspberry aroma. Bittersweet, intense flavour - the sourness underlines the fruit, weaving a lovely tapestry.

375 ml bottle from the 1st batch, so with over a year of age on it. This one pours a beautiful cloudy, deep ruby red to plum color with some pinkish tint and topped by a thick, rocky head of light dusty tan colored foam showing great retention. Some pink colored floaties of yeast speckle the foam nicely. The foam slowly settles down to a thin film and leaves thick sheets of lace that cling hard to the glass. The aroma is really nice and bright showing a great balance between funk and fruit with fresh, juicy raspberry tartness  and dry, yeasty, oak barrel notes. There are hints of cherries and blackberries to go with the fresh raspberries and dry yeast. There is ample amount of citric acidity that ties everything together nicely. The flavor follows suit with ample amounts of citric acidity from the berries with plenty of sweetness from the juicy raspberries. The barrel imparts plnety of sharp, woody funk with the right amount of vanilla to smooth out the acidity. Medium bodied with lively carbonation that enhances the dryness and the crisp, refreshing tartness. The finish is lengthy with the tart, juicy raspberries as the star of the show. This is like a hybrid between a great fruit and a belgian lambic, and great tasting to boot. This is another winner from Lost Abbey, and one I need to get a lot more of. Awesome stuff.

This one poured a murky brown/orange color with minimal head.  Aroma is raspberries and very light funk which is actually nice.  Taste is NG Raspberry tart but soured, which is amazing.  New favorite sour possibly.

Amorosa pours a murky brown color with a nice amount of fizzy raspberry colored head.  Sediment litters the glass.  No carbonation issues here.  Lacing throughout the glass as you drink.  As soon as you pop this baby open you know its sour and tart.  I held the bottle away from myself, arms length, and I could still smell the sourness of this beer. When held up to the nose you are welcomed by a nice dose of Raspberries, Tartness, small amount of a yeasty aroma, small amount of oak, and some barnyard aromas.  A tad bit funky.

As I took my first sip, my lips puckered.  This might just be the most tart and sour beer Ive ever tried.  It was hard to get past the first couple of sips.  It didnt taste bad, actually it tasted great but it was just hard.  As you drink it though it becomes easier and easier to drink and more of a pleasure.  The raspberries arent as big in the taste.  They kind of take a back seat here.  Instead the intense tartness rules here.  The funkiness of the beer also comes through more in the taste a long with the oak that it was aged in.  Raspberries linger on the tongue during the aftertaste.  If you are trying to turn someone on to a sour beer, this might not be the best place to start.  While its not the most sour beer Ive had, it was definitely up there in the tartness.  Might scare away some people.

Mouthfeel is medium bodied, smooth, and nicely carbonated.  No issues here with the bubbles.

375 ml bottle @ Patricks. Deep ruby red body with a small disappearing off-white head. A very pleasant fruity aroma of raspberries and subdued funkiness. Flavor is fruity, lots of raspberries, pleasant sourness, some acidity and moderate funk/cellar notes. Nice body, fine aftertaste. A very nice sweet and sour fruit beer, relatively moderate in the sour/wildness and still far away from the real authentic Belgium style.

Rating #1800 : When I think of excellent sours this is going to come to mind for the next few months. Once again Lost Abbey hits a grand slam with the perfect balance of sourness and depth. Just thinking about it makes me want to open a bottle of Madame Rose or something else in the cellar to revisit the experience.

Aroma / Appearance - One of the deepest red bodies I have ever seen this is a very opaque beer.  Like raspberry jam in liquid form it radiates warmth. Sharp raspberry jam on white toast is blunt and to the point. However it does such a good job that there is no reason for it to be much more complex; the intensity is enough to keep ones attention for a very long time.

Flavor / Palate - The sourness is immediate and intense. Melting the tongue it seeps into every corner of the mouth. Like drinking pure raspberry puree this takes me back to the best of the true lambics. Even after a few minutes the taste still lingers as if it had just hit the palate. Finally after a while a chocolate feel wraps itself around the back of the throat with a velvety texture. This was worth every penny although it is hardly a daily drinker at $15+. I cant wait for the next Port sour.
Bottle courtesy of collin, ok now this is the best sour Ive ever had. Huge tartness, oak aging, and the raspberries. More tart raspberries than new Glarus raspberry tart.

Sour raspberry flavor washes over the palate before leaving some sweeter candied berry notes. Touches of wood and a helping of funk with lactic tartness. High carbonation, maybe a little coarse and fizzy. A very good sour.

The body is medium and tannic with light carbonation and a long, sour, and raspberry finish.

Flavour of strong , sour, actually a bit burning raspberries, honey, strong oak and acidity. Full bodied with a mouth-drying finish of a massive amount of sour raspberries and oak again. Truly a sour ale. Top-notch.

Bottle:
Big lively light brown beige head that disappears quick and leaves a small lacing, on top of a light cloudy amber colored beer, with a dark pink ruby shine.
Smell framboise, raspberry, hint of cherries, some mild sweets, like some caramel, brown sugars and a hint of candy sweets.
Taste is a very well balanced mix of sour (light acid), malts, caramel, some slight hints of brown sugars, darker fruits like raspberry, prunes and blueberry, sparkling this all up with some hints of spices, wood and yeast.
Light dry medium sour malty sweet aftertaste.
Medium to more lively carbo, sparkling tingly mouthfeel, full body and a light watrery light sticky texture.
A pity this stuff is so damn expensive, still Amorosa danced across my taste buds, luckily!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: On tap at OBriens pouring up ruby rutty red with tiny off white head. The aroma has the standard tartness mixing with sun dried cherries and cherry sweet/tart candy. The taste is full of tartness where Im getting lemon like and berry like fruity tartness mixing cherry skins with a modestly thick body. Into the finish well below the tarter notes I get echoes of cherry and berry like fruitiness.

Bottle.  Pours a deep reddish purple amber color with a thin pinkish film.  The aroma was a wonderful sour/tart raspberry burst with some earthy pith like character.  The flavor has big raspberry fruits, nicely sour, wood, with some acidity.  This has a tingly mouthfeel and is insanely drinkable.  I was very impressed.

Oozes out of the bottle with thick, creamy, rose-colored beige head.  Bouquet is beautiful.  Sour cherries, sweet cream, oak, and, of course, raspberries.  Lots of carbonation that shocks my tongue with thick velvety body.  Unripened plum, sour apple, oak and raspberry.  One of the finest sours Ive tried.

2011 bottle at Lost Abbey tasting room. Hazy light rose with an off white head. Raspberry sour and tart aroma that once it breathed for a bit improved significantly, also developed a bit of farmhouse funk (mild). High carbonation, sour twang, medium bodied, good dry finish with raspberries.
Rust colored with a small tanned head. Wonderful rich flavours with raspberries, almonds, cookies, vinous and a nice tartness. Finishes mouthpuckering sour. Great sour ale!

Draft at Monks. Raspberries raspberries raspberries pretty much sums this beer up. Nicely tart balanced with the sweet flavor. Nice range of alcohol so its not too heavy on the tongue. Very refreshing.

Bottle courtesy of MrChopin on 01/15/2011 at the 13th Richmond Gathering. Clear reddish brown body with a small frothy off-white head. Tart fruit and raspberry aroma. Very tart fruit, raspberry flavor. Medium light body with high carbonation.

Shared a bottle with a friend. Poured into a wide mouth glass.

Pours a murky reddish brown. A small amount of head but not a lot.

Smells of tart rasberries. A slight bit of malt but not a lot. The dry/tart fruit is very strong.

Taste is sweet rasberry upfront. then changes to a very sour candy. Then evolves into a dry lingering sweetness. That makes you crave more. 

Mouthfeel is just right. The carb gives it you just enough release from the sourness.

an absolutely amazing beer. I think I will have to a trip up to the brewery to get some more bottles!!!

Appearance: deep brown
Aroma: fruits, yeasts, wild
Taste: moderate sourness, some red fruits
Palate: full body
Overall: 20/20

12.7 oz bottle from moej...er...baldwizard--thanks Joe! - Pours mahogany with ruby highlights, and a big fizzy light tan head. Raspberries on the nose--not artificial-smelling, but the real deal--though the smell isnt terribly pungent. Sour, tart malt, with a touch of chocolate-covered cherries. The taste has the same raspberry flavor, but is more tart, with an acidic tang. It has some vinous qualities, and the oak mellows and smooths everything out. Very nice--I probably should have drank this sooner so the raspberries were a little more in the forefront.

Sharp, biting carbonation, with a body thats a touch thin but that seems appropriate for the taste of the beer.

On tap at Monks. Pours a full maroon, headless. Aroma is rich of pureed raspberries with simple syrup. Flavor has really nice raspberry and green apple tartness (predominantly raspberry. Sharp, prickly mouthfeel with a sweet and tart raspberry finish. Delicious and a true tribute to raspberry, as both the sweet and tart qualities stand out.
